comment: This professor obviously had good intentions toward teaching this course, however she came into the year severely underprepared. She was hypocritical in her grading, and unclear on what she wanted within an assignment. Her grading scale is based off of if she thinks someone wrote better than you, she docks points, and not the rubric that is given.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: Her class still continues to be as similar as 10 years ago. Before our class confronted her on her wrongdoings for grading, she all graded us toughly on opinion based writing. She has mentioned quite passive-aggressive statements during her time in the classroom with us to the point where one student has reported her. She doesn't take responsible.

I have nothing good to say about this professor. She made inappropriate jokes about students and told them they would have a hard time getting a job in class. She seems like she grades based off whether she likes what you wrote. Heard that people disputed their grades and reported her after the semester. Wouldn't suggest this class to anyone.

This was the most unorganized class I have ever experienced. I know she was trying, but the whole semester was rough. The grading criteria is weird and even if something is subjective, she will mark it wrong. I would not take her if you can avoid it and save yourself the headache.

THIS IS AN AWFUL CLASS. She states that she grades papers and assignments based on the quality of other students work in the class. She will say awful things about students, thinking it's a joke, in front of the class. She does not have clear rubrics, and when she does, she doesn't follow them. She berates students and targets them. Save yourself.

Dr. Robinson is a kind person but truly an awful professor. For a hybrid class that is online a lot she has no idea how to use D2L. She is terribly spoken, always loses her train of thought, & hard to follow. She is incredibly scattered and contradicts herself all the time. Students were constantly lost and confused and she was not helpful at all.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: She is very nice, but is an awful teacher.  I hate going to class, and everyday have a new complaint about her methods.  For someone who is supposed to be teaching future educators, she shows them everything they shouldn't do.  Comes across as not knowing material, changes dates when work is due, and doesn't talk about when it is due.

Dr. Robinson is great! Very kind woman. Work is plentiful, but do all of it and you will surely get an A.  She is very flexible when it comes to late submissions, and is very easy to talk to.  Could be a bit clearer in class, but welcomes all questions.  I would take her again in a heartbeat.
Dr. Robinson is a little scattered when she comes to class. This class requires a lot of work outside of class since 1/2 is online.  It's easy to do well in her class.  I'd take her again.

She is a well intentioned woman but she is a terrible teacher. She does not speak well, can't maintain a train of thought, and does not know how to think outside the box. Makes you very frustrated/ confused AND makes you feel stupid because you don't word things exactly like she does.

There was a LOT of work for just one class and most of it came from Beth Marks who is the head of the department. Dr. Robinson is very flexible with late submissions. Just make sure to do the assignments. #1, Go to every class.  #2, Follow the syllabus with the course work schedule on it.  #3, Ask her questions when you get confused. Guaranteed A.

No in-class instruction/ did not teach. Required chapter memorization for test (Tricky tests!)--topics were never discussed in-class. And lots of projects and work! More than 3x'x my other classes. Avoid her!
